content: Posts follow a consistent structure: TL;DR, setup, experiment, results, dead end
Open3.capture3 is the standard way to call external commands in Ruby when you ne
Repository layout: bin/ for executables, lib/ for shared code if any, memory/ fo
Each tool exposes exactly one subcommand interface: tool_name action. No flags,
String interpolation in heredocs works normally. But single-quoted heredocs disa
SQLite WAL mode is enabled by default for crib database. This allows concurrent
screen runs as a standalone classifier behind a Unix pipe interface. Input on st
Error handling follows fail-open semantics: if a non-critical operation like emb
book uses a SQLite task queue rather than Redis or a message broker. Keeps the d
Smoke tests use a temporary database via CRIB_DB pointing to a mktemp directory.
Each tool repo uses a single main branch with no feature branches. Commits go di
Antecedent basis rule: never reference internal module names or jargon in descri
A classifier prompt that worked for Python code detection returned false negativ
All tools use Ruby stdlib only â€” no gems. This eliminates Bundler, gemspec files
Commit messages use a tool-name prefix followed by a colon: crib: add consolidat
Temperature 0.0 does not guarantee deterministic output from gemma3 1b. Across 1
The most common failure mode across all tools is ollama timing out. Embedding ca
spill structured its log entries as JSON lines rather than plain text. Every ent
spill logs to a single SQLite database shared across all tools. Each log entry r
Log messages are sentences, not codes. stored entry #42 (decision), 3 triples ex
